mention.text: A Filipino serving with the U.S. Navy

the eruption when his car collided with a bus on an ash-slicked road north of the Subic Bay naval base Residents of nearby Angeles panicked when a huge , gray-greenish mushroom cloud burst from the volcano and turned day
the Subic Bay naval base Residents
night Thousands of fleeing people packed roads
director of the Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology
the Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology
The Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology
the Philippine Institute of Vulcanology and Seismology
Clark , home to 15,000 American military personnel
Monday The base did not appear immediately threatened by volcanic flow
the air that at noon , motorists were driving with their headlights and windshield wipers on

the air that at noon , motorists were driving with their headlights was followed by a second explosion a few minutes later and a third , smaller blast at 11:49 a.m. ; The huge plume could be seen in Manila
a second explosion a few minutes later
the volcano 's western slopes Raymundo Punongbayan said strong tremors preceded the nighttime eruptions and continued afterward
an explosion of superheated gas , ashes and rocks that killed 38 people
